intro: Lucuma warmingii, commonly known as the Andean starfruit, is a tropical plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Actinidiaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped fruit that resembles a small star. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and inconspicuous. The fruit, which is the most notable feature, is encased in a thin, leathery husk and contains several seeds.
